body:
The old `CAFFE_KNOWN_TYPE` already had the hard requirement that it's called inside the `::caffe2` namespace because c++ compilers only allow specializing when you're in the same namespace as the original definition. This doesn't change this requirement.

In the end, the goal would be to have `C10_KNOWN_TYPE` everywhere, but it's not my highest priority currently.
